Australia Post
Help & Support
Reference {!Case.CaseNumber}
Update for {!Case.Type} - {!Case.CaseNumber}
Hi,
Thank you for taking the time to contact us about the SMS you received. I'm sure I can help you further.
Based on the information you have provided I can confirm that the SMS you received is a scam. Australia Post is currently aware of a fraudulent SMS circulating regarding a parcel being held at "Terminal 2" requiring further payment. The SMS will also contain a link which will request you to make a small shipping payment and enter your personal details. Please note that Australia Post will never SMS customers requesting further payment or personal information.
Moving forward, I would suggest that you please disregard and delete the SMS.
If you continue to receive similar messages in the future Iâ€™ve included some tips on how to best deal with them.
- Do not click on any links - Report any scam emails to Scamwatch at: https://www.scamwatch.gov.au/report-a-scam - Delete the message upon reporting it to Scamwatch.
Please also be aware that Australia Post will never: - Email/SMS you to reconfirm your address by clicking a link - Send you an email/SMS asking for your password, credit card details or account information - SMS, call or email you unexpectedly to request a payment
Thank you for bringing this to our attention and I do hope that this information has provided some clarity.
Regards,
Australia Post {!Case.Thread_Id}
